creator: rsherk@hotmail.com
text:
The following error message is reported in 
Viewed from 'Computer Management'->'System tools'->'Event
Viewer'->'Application'.  The apache notice is reporting that it has disabled use
of winsock2 api (probably because I have VPN software installed).  This probably
should have an Event Type of 'Information' instead of 'Error'.  (?)

--Start-------
Event Type:	Error
Event Source:	Apache Service
Event Category:	None
Event ID:	3299
Date:		7/31/2004
Time:		11:14:32 AM
User:		N/A
Computer:	LILLY
Description:
The Apache service named  reported the following error:
>>> [Sat Jul 31 11:14:32 2004] [notice] Disabled use of 
Viewed from 'Computer Management'->'System tools'->'Event Viewer'->'Application'
WinSock2 API     .

For more information, see Help and Support Center at
http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/events.asp.
---End------

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text: *** Bug 31014 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 31014 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: wrowe@apache.org
wrowe@apache.org
text:
Because this was a fatal and not a transitory/non-fatal issue, your example
was an Error, and not Informational.

However, there are multiple error levels in the error logging which should
be reflected in the event log, so I'm leaving this open as an enhancement 
request.
